comment: he put 0 grades in d2l and i never knew what to study for the midterm/final

Dr. Rice is a great guy and a great professor. He has a passion for American Literature. You are graded on group assignments, a midterm, a final, and a term paper. None are too strenuous if you read, pay attention, and attend class regularly.

Dr. Rice is hilarious and made class super fun despite it being really awkward given how small of a group we had. Didn't expect too much and was always considerate about deadlines. Really great guy and wants his students to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Mr. Rice isn't a bad guy at all. He is super sweet and knows the material he is teaching. If you do end up taking him, do not slack off. You will need to read a lot of material, and I am guilty of not doing this. It is super easy to put this class off due to how boring the material is, but you will fail if you don't make this class your main focus.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Rice is a very sweet man and an interesting conversationalist, but he is not a good teacher. He's very disorganized & almost everything you do is a group project. The syllabus was constantly changing, guidelines were never clear, and the "study guides" were lacking and posted the day before an exam. A lot of unnecessary stress & extra work :(
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: He only cares about making less work for himself. He makes huge groups of 6-7 people and forces them to collectively write a one-page paper every single week. This is WAY too many people and everyone is miserable! His lectures are fine but everything else is a group project. His class has been nothing but dysfunction, confusion, and frustration.

This man struggles with technology. Maybe in person there is a different experience. He is scatterbrained and the class was so stressful. He was unclear when explaining assignments and I learned more from interactions with my peers on GroupMe than I learned from his rambling lectures and obsession with developing tension. Avoid taking him online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Rice is a character. Never pronounced my name correctly, but he's too cute of an old man to correct. Graded on three things: midterm, long seminar paper, and a final. That's it. The books he assigns are really interesting and make for good discussion among classmates. Just another mandatory class. Did not learn nor will I ever use any of it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: The class is based around workshopping short stories, but he does a great job of giving relevant lectures that help newer writers understand the mistakes they're making. My writing has definitely improved because of this class. He's a passionate guy and he gives great feedback on the stories. Tends to be a "B" grader in my experience.

He has an obvious passion for American Literature and it overflows into the class. He is definitely a "B" grader, but if you are invested and do the readings you should be fine. Most of the class was based around the readings and discussion of the readings, so they're the main portion of the work. He's a great, helpful guy and I enjoyed his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: You get to buy a ton of novels and read them with no real time schedule on when to finish them. He's obviously passionate about his teachings but it can be really difficult to follow and his lectures are very boring. Attendance also counts towards your final grade and it will drop if you skip a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Rice is very passionate about the subject matter which helped during lectures, but the class was pretty boring most days. We only had 4 graded assignments so not a lot of wiggle room. He is willing to help you if you ask, and if you show up to class and read the books the tests arent too bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: The dullest class ever. He's a nice guy.

His class is not easy; it is hard. Despite having to do a 25 page paper, he expects you to read a ton of books, which most students simply did not do. He does give written feedback on most assignments. He is clear for the most part, but refused discussion of the last film screened in class. I was interested in the subject before attending class.

Dr. Rice was extremely nice and understanding. His class was not the easiest. He expects perfect attendance, thorough readings of texts, and class participation/discussion. Unfortunately, I was a bit lacking in the last two, which resulted in a B. His tests are difficult because you don?t know what to expect, but you never really know.

Dr. Rice is awesome, I just wish I had realized it at the time. Looking back, he engaged me more in that one class than I have experienced in any other college course. At first it will seem like a lot of work and reading, but after it is finished you will have more knowledge and respect for the texts he uses. Very bright and energetic.

BEST. TEACHER. EVER. Dr. Rice cares about his students and makes class interesting in fun. His classes are no cake walk and you definately get out of them what you put in. Everything that you do in his classes is geared towards making you not only a better person, but also a better student. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Dr. Rice is an amazing, personable, engaging and encouraging professor. One of the best I've ever had. Take any class he teaches if you can. Midterm, Final, 10-12 pg. paper and some outside group project (but simple ones). Can't speak more highly of him; one of the best profs I've ever had. I am just sorry that I am graduating and can't take more!

Awesome, awesome, awesome. I am working on a second B.A. and I got more insight and depth of understanding about the world from this prof than ANY I've had before. He is challenging, engaging and very interesting(and that's hard to do in a 2 and 1/2 hr class). Humorous, open. Tests: U gotta think. Short discussion and essay questions. Recommend!!!

I loved this class. Dr. Rice was really nice, funny, engaging, and helpful in and out of class. He met with each student about our final 20-25 page paper. He does have other assignments for the class, but no tests or quizzes. He is very personal and loves to talk about his life and the life of his students. Really nice teacher and willing to help.
